segment.source: Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: The Windows Store for Business is where you can find and purchase apps for your organization, individually or in volume.
segment.target: The Windows Store for Business is where you can find and purchase apps for your organization, individually or in volume.

segment.source: By connecting the store to , you can manage volume-purchased apps from the console, for example:
segment.target: By connecting the store to , you can manage volume-purchased apps from the console, for example:

segment.source: You can synchronize the list of purchased apps with
segment.target: You can synchronize the list of purchased apps with

segment.source: Apps that are synchronized appear in the console and you can deploy these like any other apps
segment.target: Apps that are synchronized appear in the console and you can deploy these like any other apps

segment.source: You can track how many licenses are available, and how many are being used in the console
segment.target: You can track how many licenses are available, and how many are being used in the console

segment.source: blocks deployment and installation of apps if you don't have enough licenses
segment.target: blocks deployment and installation of apps if you don't have enough licenses

segment.source: Before you start
segment.target: Before you start

segment.source: Review the following information before you start syncing and deploying apps from the Windows Store for Business:
segment.target: Review the following information before you start syncing and deploying apps from the Windows Store for Business:

segment.source: You must configure as the mobile device management authority for your organization.
segment.target: You must configure as the mobile device management authority for your organization.

segment.source: For more information, see Set mobile device management authority and configure Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Set mobile device management authority and configure Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You must have a valid account for the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: You must have a valid account for the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Apps purchased from the store cannot be manually added to or deleted from .
segment.target: Apps purchased from the store cannot be manually added to or deleted from .

segment.source: They can only be synchronized with the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: They can only be synchronized with the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Associate your Windows Store for Business account with Intune
segment.target: Associate your Windows Store for Business account with Intune

segment.source: Before you enable synchronization in the console, you must configure your store account to use as a management tool:
segment.target: Before you enable synchronization in the console, you must configure your store account to use as a management tool:

segment.source: Ensure that you log into the Business Store using the same tenant account you use to log into .
segment.target: Ensure that you log into the Business Store using the same tenant account you use to log into .

segment.source: In the Business Store, choose Settings > Management tools.
segment.target: In the Business Store, choose Settings > Management tools.

segment.source: On the Management tools page, choose Add a management tool, and choose Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: On the Management tools page, choose Add a management tool, and choose Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You can now set up synchronization in the console.
segment.target: You can now set up synchronization in the console.

segment.source: Configure synchronization
segment.target: Configure synchronization

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin.

segment.source: In the Administration workspace, expand Mobile Device Management > Windows, and then click Store for Business.
segment.target: In the Administration workspace, expand Mobile Device Management > Windows, and then click Store for Business.

segment.source: On the Windows Store for Business page, do the following:
segment.target: On the Windows Store for Business page, do the following:

segment.source: If you haven't already done so, click the link to sign up for the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: If you haven't already done so, click the link to sign up for the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Once you are signed up, click Configure Sync.
segment.target: Once you are signed up, click Configure Sync.

segment.source: In the Configure Windows Store for Business app sync dialog box, select Enable Windows Store for Business sync.
segment.target: In the Configure Windows Store for Business app sync dialog box, select Enable Windows Store for Business sync.

segment.source: Once you have completed this step, you cannot delete the association between Intune and the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Once you have completed this step, you cannot delete the association between Intune and the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: From the Language drop-down list, choose the language in which apps from the Windows Store for Business will be displayed in the console.
segment.target: From the Language drop-down list, choose the language in which apps from the Windows Store for Business will be displayed in the console.

segment.source: Regardless of the language in which they are displayed, they will be installed in the end user's language when available.
segment.target: Regardless of the language in which they are displayed, they will be installed in the end user's language when available.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Synchronize apps
segment.target: Synchronize apps

segment.source: On the Windows Store for Business page, click Sync now to synchronize your purchased apps with .
segment.target: On the Windows Store for Business page, click Sync now to synchronize your purchased apps with .

segment.source: In the Apps workspace, click Apps > Volume-Purchased Apps to view the available apps and to verify that your purchased apps were imported correctly.
segment.target: In the Apps workspace, click Apps > Volume-Purchased Apps to view the available apps and to verify that your purchased apps were imported correctly.

segment.source: The apps in this node are displayed with the total number of licenses you own, together with the number of licenses you have available.
segment.target: The apps in this node are displayed with the total number of licenses you own, together with the number of licenses you have available.

segment.source: Deploy apps
segment.target: Deploy apps

segment.source: You deploy apps in the same way you deploy any other app.
segment.target: You deploy apps in the same way you deploy any other app.

segment.source: For more information, see Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: When you deploy a Windows Store for Business app, a license is used by each user who installs the app.
segment.target: When you deploy a Windows Store for Business app, a license is used by each user who installs the app.

segment.source: If you use all of the available licenses for a deployed app, you will not be able to deploy any more copies and must take one of the following actions (error -2016344194 (FFFFFFFFFECC548F), InstErrOutOfLicenses is displayed in the admin console):
segment.target: If you use all of the available licenses for a deployed app, you will not be able to deploy any more copies and must take one of the following actions (error -2016344194 (FFFFFFFFFECC548F), InstErrOutOfLicenses is displayed in the admin console):

segment.source: Uninstall the app from some devices
segment.target: Uninstall the app from some devices

segment.source: Reduce the scope of the current deployment to target only the users you have sufficient licenses for
segment.target: Reduce the scope of the current deployment to target only the users you have sufficient licenses for

segment.source: Buy more copies of the app from the Windows Store for Business
segment.target: Buy more copies of the app from the Windows Store for Business

segment.source: See also
segment.target: See also

segment.source: Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune
